intro: Scabiosa lucida f. hirticaulis, commonly known as the hairy scabious, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Native to the Mediterranean region, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. The hairy texture of its stems and leaves is a distinguishing feature of this cultivar. It is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
